result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary hearing on June 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

No motor vehicle operation at all.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.    Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin   medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant needs to signed the bond within 48 hours or a warrant will issue.

04:05 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Aaron Thomas Lowe, appeared with Attorney Dorothea Claire Watson, both by audio.  Defendant needs to be here to sign bond by Thursday 4 pm  or a warrant will be issued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
